item.value: The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The longest word in a major English dictionary is 'Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis'. It is 45 characters long.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is the largest planet.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters. The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
The 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics was won by Albert Einstein for his work in the field of theoretical physics.
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.

Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876. By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billions land lines in the world. China had more than 350 million phones, more than any other country.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
Elephants demonstrate concern for members of their families they take care of weak or injured members and appear to grieve over a dead companion.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun. They are divided into two groups: the inner planets (Mercury, Venus,Earth, and Mars) and the outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto).
The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface. It is 155.557 million sq km.
